articles.title: Apple (AAPL) Spending Cuts Drain Rally; IBM Beats Again
articles.content: A report regarding Apple Inc. (AAPL) slowing its pace of hiring and spending in some (as yet undetermined) segments sent shares down -2%.

articles.title: Captain America And Donald Trump Agree On Missing This iPhone Feature
articles.content:
A key feature on the iPhone continues to divide people with some missing it and others being able to move on. A superhero and former president might agree on their feelings about the feature.
What Happened: With the introduction of the iPhone X, Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) got rid of the physical home button, instead relying on gesture technology.
Chris Evans, who is perhaps best known for playing superhero Captain America for Walt Disney Co (NYSE: DIS), shared recently he’s not a fan of the change, according to The Verge.
In a press interview to promote the Netflix Inc (NASDAQ: NFLX) movie “The Gray Man,” Evans shared with Collider that he prefers his old iPhone 6S, ...

articles.title: Bernstein Bets On Apple Citing Its China Connect; Hikes Q3 Estimates
articles.content:
Bernstein analyst Toni Sacconaghi modestly increased his Q3 estimates on Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) due to better-than-expected supply availability in the quarter and healthy Chinese demand, offset by incremental currency headwinds. 
He raised the Q3 estimates (revenues from $82.8 billion to $84.0 billion, EPS from $1.17 to $1.19) due to better than expected supply availability in the quarter (he saw the $4-8 billion expected headwind coming in at the low end or below) and healthier Chinese demand, offset by incremental currency headwinds. The effect is that he is 2% higher than consensus on revenues and 3.5% higher on EPS. 
He forecast services growth of 12%, driven by a tough advertising comp and lackluster App store growth. 
Further, Sacconaghi sees conflicting forces at play for ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: Looking To Trade Alphabet (Google) Following 20-1 Stock Split? Here's An Updated Chart
articles.content:
Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) was trading mostly flat on Monday following a 20-1 stock split. The split brought shares of Alphabet’s Class C stock (GOOG) down from Friday’s closing price of $2,255.34 to a split-adjusted price of $113.44.
The stock split means that every shareholder received 19 additional shares for each share of Alphabet they owned. The split made shares of the tech giant more attractive to retail investors and for options traders, and the price of both calls and puts has also become more affordable.
Alphabet didn’t run up higher into the event, although the stock reversed course into an uptrend on June 17, which may have surprised investors who watched Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) and Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) surge prior to their stock splits in 2020.
The patterns Alphabet ...

articles.title: Netflix's SpaceX Documentary Nominated For An Emmy: Here's The Award It Could Win
articles.content:
A documentary about SpaceX has been nominated for an Emmy Award. Here’s a look at the award the show could win and its competition.
What Happened: The documentary series “Return to Space” has been nominated for an Emmy Award for “Outstanding Music Composition for a Documentary Series or Special (Original Dramatic Score).”
The series centers on a mission to send NASA astronauts back to the International Space Station by SpaceX, a company founded by Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) CEO Elon Musk.
The series was released in April on Netflix Inc (NASDAQ: NFLX).
Mychael Danna and Harry Gregson-Williams are credited as the composers for the show. Danna has seven Emmy Award ...

articles.title: Can Apple (AAPL) Keep the Earnings Surprise Streak Alive?
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) has an impressive earnings surprise history and currently possesses the right combination of the two key ingredients for a likely beat in its next quarterly report.

articles.title: Read Why This Analyst Downgraded Rating On Paramount Global
articles.content:
Morgan Stanley analyst Benjamin Swinburne downgraded Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA) from Equal-Weight to Underweight and cut the price target from $32 to $22.
The pivot to streaming has not reduced the risk to media estimates from a slowing economy, Swinburne notes. Advertisers and consumers are likely to pull back in a recession at a time when some media these stocks have outperformed the market year-to-date thanks to already low multiples, he reasoned. 
He is "incrementally cautious" on the TV/streaming group, saying the pivot to streaming "is about to get more difficult." 
Swinburne sees rising ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: Disney (DIS) Set to Hike ESPN+ Subscription Price by 43%
articles.content: Disney (DIS) is hiking subscription price of ESPN+ by 43% to $9.99 on a monthly basis beginning Aug 23.
